# Code of Conduct

## Our Pledge
We, as members, contributors, and leaders of this organization, pledge to make participation in our projects a respectful, welcoming, and harassment-free experience for everyone.  
We are committed to creating an environment where every participant can contribute and collaborate regardless of age, education, technical skill level, gender, identity, or background.

## Our Standards
Examples of behavior that contributes to a positive environment include:
- Demonstrating empathy and kindness toward others  
- Being respectful of different viewpoints and experiences  
- Giving and gracefully accepting constructive feedback  
- Taking responsibility and apologizing when necessary  
- Focusing on what is best for the project and community  

Examples of unacceptable behavior include:
- Harassment, discrimination, or derogatory comments  
- Personal attacks or insults  
- Publishing private information without permission  
- Excessive criticism without constructive intent  
- Any other conduct that could be reasonably considered inappropriate  

## Enforcement Responsibilities
Project leaders and maintainers are responsible for clarifying and enforcing this Code of Conduct.  
They have the right to take corrective action in response to any behavior that violates these rules, including warnings, temporary restrictions, or removal from the project spaces.

## Scope
This Code of Conduct applies within:
- all project repositories  
- issue trackers, pull requests, discussions  
- communication channels related to the project  
- offline or online activities representing the project or organization  

## Enforcement
Instances of abusive, harassing, or otherwise unacceptable behavior may be reported to the project maintainers or organization administrators.

Reports will be handled promptly, fairly, and in accordance with the principles of privacy and security.  
All complaints will be reviewed and investigated, resulting in a response deemed necessary and appropriate to the situation.

## Enforcement Guidelines
In case of violations, maintainers may take actions including but not limited to:
1. **The Warning** — A private notice regarding the inappropriate behavior  
2. **Temporary Suspension** — Restricted participation for a defined period  
3. **Permanent Ban** — Removal from participation in the project or organization  

## Attribution
This Code of Conduct is inspired by the Contributor Covenant (https://www.contributor-covenant.org/) version 2.1.
